titleStmt.title: Sanskrit Manuscripts in the Bodleian Libraries
titleStmt.funder: The cataloguing of this item was made possible through a benefaction from the late John P. Clay, founder and benefactor of the Clay Sanskrit Library.

msDesc.head: A composite manuscript containing ten manuscript works on vyākaraṇa, bound together in the Bodleian Library.

binding.p: Early 20th-century brown textile binding over pasteboard, with shelfmark and description tooled in gold on the spine. Cardboard cover box.

history.acquisition:
Donated by
Shum Shere, Chandra Mahārāja Chandra Shamsher Jang Bahadur Rana in 1909.

recordHist.source: Description by Barbora Sojkova, based on observation of the manuscript and existing descriptions.

msContents.summary: A paper manuscript containing Durgasiṃha's Kātantra Dhātupāṭha up to gaṇa 1, and the Pāṇinīya Gaṇapāṭha.

msItem.title: Kātantra Dhātupāṭha
msItem.rubric: F. 3v [f. 1v in original foliation]: śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ ||

msItem.title: Gaṇapāṭha
msItem.colophon: F. 28v [f. 26v in original foliation]: śrī gaṇāpaṭhe || harivaṁ govardhana dīkṣita sūnu rāmakṛṣṇa viracite '[?]modhyāyaḥ samāptaḥ || @ || māgha śukla pratipadā kula vāsara || saṁvat 1882 ||

supportDesc.foliation: Devanāgarī numerals, top-left and bottom-right margin, verso
Arabic numerals in pencil, bottom-right corner, recto (added by Gambier-Parry, Thomas Thomas Gambier-Parry); this foliation starts with the first flyleaf).

handNote.desc: Devanāgarī in black ink. Corrections in yellow.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card, for admissions procedures contact Bodleian Libraries' Admissions Office.

analytic.title: A Handlist of the Vyākaraṇa Manuscripts in the Chandra Shum Shere Collection Preserved in the Bodleian Library.

msContents.summary: A fragment of a previously undescribed paper manuscript of the Avyayārthalaharī.

msItem.title: Avyayārthalaharī

note.p: [Title on f. 30r and curator's note in pencil on the front paste down read Avyayārthakārikā.]

msItem.rubric: F. 30v [f. 1v in original foliation]: śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ ||

supportDesc.foliation: Devanāgarī numerals, top-left and bottom-right margin, verso
Arabic numerals in pencil, bottom-right corner, recto (added by Gambier-Parry, Thomas Thomas Gambier-Parry); this foliation starts with the first flyleaf).

handNote.desc: Devanāgarī in black ink. Verse numbers highlighted in red powder.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card, for admissions procedures contact Bodleian Libraries' Admissions Office.

msContents.summary: A paper manuscript containing the complete Dhātupāṭha of the Pāṇiniyan tradition and the complete Prayogavivekasaṃgraha of Vararuci in 31 verses.

msItem.title: Dhātupāṭha
msItem.colophon: F. 52v [f. 19v in original foliation]: iti śrī pāṇinīya dhātupāṭhaḥ samāptaḥ ||

msItem.title: Prayogavivekasaṃgraha

note.p: [Colophon calls the whole work Kārakacakra, but this properly applies only to the first paṭala which ends after verse 12.]

msItem.colophon: F 54r [f. 21v in original foliation]: iti vararuci kṛte prayogavivekasaṃgrahe kārakacakra samāptim agamat || cha || śrī || saṃdhyā pradeśe saṃdhyāyāṃ saṃdhyā karmasu parvasu || japa manyatra kuvīta punaḥ Saṁdhdhyāṃ samācaret || ||1|| ||

supportDesc.support:
Paper. First and last folio written on thick yellow paper.
12 26
supportDesc.foliation: Devanāgarī numerals, bottom-right margin, verso
Arabic numerals in pencil, bottom-right corner, recto (added by Gambier-Parry, Thomas Thomas Gambier-Parry); this foliation starts with the first flyleaf).

condition.p: Complete. F. 40v [f. 7v in original foliation] is left empty.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card, for admissions procedures contact Bodleian Libraries' Admissions Office.

analytic.title: A Handlist of the Vyākaraṇa Manuscripts in the Chandra Shum Shere Collection Preserved in the Bodleian Library.

msContents.summary: A complete paper manuscript of Anantācārya's Saṃskṛtamañjarī.

msItem.title: Saṃskṛtamañjarī
msItem.rubric: F. 56v [f. 1v in original foliation]: śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ ||

supportDesc.foliation: Devanāgarī numerals, top-right margin, verso
Arabic numerals in pencil, bottom-right corner, recto (added by Gambier-Parry, Thomas Thomas Gambier-Parry); this foliation starts with the first flyleaf).

condition.p: The text block of a few folios rubbed away, with loss of some akṣaras. Damaged right margin on last three folios.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card, for admissions procedures contact Bodleian Libraries' Admissions Office.

analytic.title: A Handlist of the Vyākaraṇa Manuscripts in the Chandra Shum Shere Collection Preserved in the Bodleian Library.

msContents.summary: A paper manuscript of Anantācārya's Saṃskṛtamañjarī.

msItem.title: Saṃskṛtamañjarī
msItem.colophon: F 67v: iti śrī saṃskṛta maṃjarī samāpteti śrī kṛṣmaḥ saṃvat 1879 mitiñptāṣāḍa kṛṣma 2 vāragurutni [?] prācāryavakhatarāmeṇāt nipiktataṁ paṭhaṇārthaṁ || yāṁtviṁtayāmi 1 satananaṃhi [?] ṣāniri [... damaged text]

supportDesc.foliation: Devanāgarī numerals, top-left margin, verso
Arabic numerals in pencil, bottom-right corner, recto (added by Gambier-Parry, Thomas Thomas Gambier-Parry); this foliation starts with the first flyleaf).

condition.p: The original ff. 2 and 5 are missing.
In good condition. The colophon is partially rubbed away with a loss of some akṣaras.

handNote.desc: Devanāgarī in black ink. Invocation highlighted in red powder, corrections in yellow.

history.origin:
saṃvat 1879 / 1822 CE.
In colophon: Copied on Thursday 2 kṛṣṇapakṣa of Āṣāḍhasaṃvat 1879 1822 CE.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card, for admissions procedures contact Bodleian Libraries' Admissions Office.

analytic.title: A Handlist of the Vyākaraṇa Manuscripts in the Chandra Shum Shere Collection Preserved in the Bodleian Library.

msContents.summary: A complete paper manuscript of the Dhātupāṭha in the Pāṇinīya's tradition.

msItem.title: Dhātupāṭha
msItem.rubric: F. 69r [f. 1r in original foliation]: oṃ śrī ganeśāya namaḥ
msItem.incipit: F. 69r [f. 1r in original foliation]: oṃ tāṃ bhavāṃnī bhavāktteśanāśaviśāradā
msItem.colophon: F. 86r [f. 18r in original foliation]: 1951 samāptoyaṃ || dhātupāṭhaḥ || śubham astuntekhaka pāṭhakayoḥ ||

supportDesc.foliation: Devanāgarī numerals, top-left and bottom-right margin, verso
Arabic numerals in pencil, bottom-right corner, recto (added by Gambier-Parry, Thomas Thomas Gambier-Parry); this foliation starts with the first flyleaf).

handNote.desc: Devanāgarī in black ink. Highlighted in red powder.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card, for admissions procedures contact Bodleian Libraries' Admissions Office.

analytic.title: A Handlist of the Vyākaraṇa Manuscripts in the Chandra Shum Shere Collection Preserved in the Bodleian Library.

msContents.summary: A complete paper manuscript of Manudāsa's Ṣaṭkārakaprakriyā.

msItem.title: Ṣaṭkārakaprakriyā
msItem.rubric: F. 88v [f. 1v in original foliation]: || śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ ||
msItem.incipit: F. 88v [f. 1v in original foliation]: ṣadkārakāṇikathyante saṃbaṃdha sahitānivai'yeṣāṁvijñāta mātre ṇāsaskṛtaṁ jñāyate dhruvam ||
msItem.colophon: F. 111 r. [f. 24r in original foliation]: || iti śrī ṣadkāraka pratkiyāsamāptā || śubham astu || || ||

supportDesc.foliation: Devanāgarī numerals, top-left and bottom-right margin, verso
Arabic numerals in pencil, bottom-right corner, recto (added by Gambier-Parry, Thomas Thomas Gambier-Parry); this foliation starts with the first flyleaf).

handNote.desc: Devanāgarī in black and red ink.

Volume VI. Vyākaraṇa Manuscripts.

msContents.summary: A complete paper manuscript of Vaijaladeva's Prabodhacandrikā.

msItem.title: Prabodhacandrikā
msItem.rubric: F. 113v [f. 1v in original foliation]: śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ
msItem.incipit: F. 113v [f. 1v in original foliation]: harihara gurubhaktaḥ sarvalokānurakta stribhūvana gatakārtikaḥ kāṃti kaṃdarpamūrtiḥ ||
msItem.colophon: F. 134r [f. 22r in original foliation]: iti śrīmad vaijala bhūpāla kṛtā prabodhacandrikā samāptā || || tā ide ity upādvaviṣṇunā likhitaṃ || || saṃvat 1868 citra bhānu saṃvatsare kāt[?]ka kṛṣṇā pratipadi samāpteyaṁ || śrīviśvaraparṇam astu prasannostu || iti vaijalabhūpāla kṛtprabodhasya caṁdrikā tasyām eṣā samāptāṁ syā chchāyyā saṃdheṣvacaṇdrikā maheśvā[?] || pāṇinaye namaḥ || || graṃthasaṁkhyeyaṁ || 420 || samāpti sūcakāścāṣṭho 8 || 12 | 21 | 55 | 64 | 37 | 38 | 35 | 70 || prati caṃdrikā śloka gaṇaneyaṁ || pāṇinikātyāyanapatāñjalibhyo namaḥ idam arpaṇam api teṣām evāstu || maheśvarāyārpaṇam astu ca || karve ity upanāmnaḥ śrīgopīnāthasya pustakaṁ īyaṁ pudhavaraiḥ samyakavi cārya ca muhura muḍhuḥ || 2 || ||
msItem.finalRubric: F. 134v [f. 22v in original foliation]: || iti śabda śāstropayuktā prabodhacaṃdrikā ||

supportDesc.foliation: Devanāgarī numerals, top-left and bottom-right margin, verso
Arabic numerals in pencil, bottom-right corner, recto (added by Gambier-Parry, Thomas Thomas Gambier-Parry); this foliation starts with the first flyleaf).

handNote.desc: Devanāgarī in black ink. Highlighted in red powder. Ruled in red ink.

msContents.summary: A complete paper manuscript of Vararuci's Prayogavivekasaṃgraha in 25 verses.

msItem.title: Prayogavivekasaṃgraha
msItem.rubric: F. 136v [f. 1v in original foliation]: śrī gaṇādhipa tathe namaḥ ||
msItem.colophon: F. 137v [f. 2v in original foliation]: iti śrī vararuci viracitaṃ kāracakraṃ samāptaṃ
msItem.note: The colophon, written in a different hand, calls the work the Kārakacakra, but this applies only to the first paṭala which ends after verse 7.

supportDesc.foliation: Devanāgarī numerals, top-left and bottom-right margin, verso
Arabic numerals in pencil, bottom-right corner, recto (added by Gambier-Parry, Thomas Thomas Gambier-Parry); this foliation starts with the first flyleaf).

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card, for admissions procedures contact Bodleian Libraries' Admissions Office.

analytic.title: A Handlist of the Vyākaraṇa Manuscripts in the Chandra Shum Shere Collection Preserved in the Bodleian Library.

msContents.summary: A complete paper manuscript of Vararuci's Samāsacakra.

msItem.title: Samāsacakra
msItem.note: This is the second paṭala, or verses 9-11, of the Prayogavivekasaṃgraha, together with a simple exposition and examples.
msItem.rubric: F. 139v [f. 1v in original foliation]: śrī gaṇeśāya namaḥ
msItem.incipit: F. 139v [f. 1v in original foliation]: prayogas trividhaḥ || kartari prayogaḥ || karmaṇi prayogaḥ ||

supportDesc.foliation: Devanāgarī numerals, bottom-right margin, verso
Arabic numerals in pencil, bottom-right corner, recto (added by Gambier-Parry, Thomas Thomas Gambier-Parry); this foliation starts with the first flyleaf).

category.catDesc: General teaching on ethics and particular ethical topics
Narrative literature relating to the Jinas, early Jain teachers, and individual characters
